examples.sentence: 〜てほしい (te-hoshii) - Want someone to do
ほしがる - Third person form

sections.heading: What is ほしい (hoshii)?
sections.content:
ほしい (欲しい) is an i-adjective meaning "want" or "desire." It's used when you want a physical object, thing, or abstract noun - not an action.

[Noun] + が + ほしい お金がほしい "I want money" 車がほしい "I want a car"

children.heading: With Objects
children.content: お金がほしい "I want money" 新しい車がほしい "I want a new car" 時間がほしい "I want time" 友達がほしい "I want friends"

children.heading: ほしい: Want things/nouns
children.content: 本がほしい "I want a book" 水がほしい "I want water" 休みがほしい "I want a day off"

children.heading: たい: Want to do actions
children.content: 本を読みたい "I want to read a book" 水を飲みたい "I want to drink water" 休みたい "I want to rest"

sections.heading: Conjugation
sections.content: ほしい conjugates like an i-adjective.

children.heading: Present Affirmative
children.content: ほしい / ほしいです "want" お金がほしい "I want money"

children.heading: Present Negative
children.content: ほしくない / ほしくないです / ほしくありません "don't want" お金はほしくない "I don't want money"

children.heading: Past Affirmative
children.content: ほしかった / ほしかったです "wanted" お金がほしかった "I wanted money"

children.heading: Past Negative
children.content: ほしくなかった / ほしくなかったです / ほしくありませんでした "didn't want" お金はほしくなかった "I didn't want money"

children.heading: が Marks the Desired Object
children.content: 本がほしい "I want a book" 水がほしい "I want water" 新しいパソコンがほしい "I want a new computer"

children.heading: は for Topic/Contrast
children.content: お金はほしくない "As for money, I don't want it" これがほしいです。それはほしくないです "I want this. I don't want that"

children.heading: とても/すごく〜ほしい (really want)
children.content: とてもほしい "really want" すごくほしい "really want" めちゃくちゃほしい "really, really want"

children.heading: 〜がほしいです (polite)
children.content: 新しい車がほしいです "I want a new car" もっと時間がほしいです "I want more time"

children.heading: 〜がほしいんです (explanatory)
children.content: お金がほしいんです "The thing is, I want money" アドバイスがほしいんですが "I want advice (and...)"

children.heading: Direct Questions
children.content:
Used when asking the person directly:

何がほしい？ "What do you want?" プレゼント、何がほしい？ "What do you want for a present?" 誕生日に何がほしいですか？ "What do you want for your birthday?"

children.heading: About Third Person
children.content:
Less direct, often softer:

彼は何がほしいと思う？ "What do you think he wants?" 何をほしがっていますか？ "What does he want?" (using ほしがる)

sections.heading: Abstract Desires
sections.content:
ほしい works with abstract nouns too:

時間がほしい "I want time" 自由がほしい "I want freedom" 平和がほしい "I want peace" 愛がほしい "I want love" 勇気がほしい "I want courage"

children.heading: Example 1: Birthday Present
children.content: A: 誕生日、何がほしい？ "What do you want for your birthday?" B: 新しい時計がほしいな "I want a new watch" A: どんな時計？ "What kind of watch?" B: シンプルなのがいいな "A simple one would be good"

children.heading: Example 2: Expressing Needs
children.content: A: 大丈夫？疲れてる？ "Are you okay? Are you tired?" B: うん、休みがほしい "Yeah, I want a break" A: ゆっくり休んでね "Get some rest"

children.heading: Example 3: Shopping
children.content: A: これ、ほしい？ "Do you want this?" B: うん、すごくほしい！ "Yeah, I really want it!" A: じゃあ、買おう "Then let's buy it"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using を instead of が
children.content: Wrong: 本をほしい ❌ Right: 本がほしい ✓ "I want a book"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Confusing with たい
children.content: Wrong: 食べるがほしい ❌ Right: 食べたい ✓ "I want to eat" Correct ほしい usage: 食べ物がほしい ✓ "I want food"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Using for actions
children.content: Wrong: 行くがほしい ❌ Right: 行きたい ✓ "I want to go"

children.heading: Mistake 4: Wrong conjugation
children.content: Wrong: ほしくないかった ❌ Right: ほしくなかった ✓ "didn't want"

children.heading: First Person (direct)
children.content: 私はお金がほしい "I want money" ほしい "I want (it)"

children.heading: Third Person (use ほしがる)
children.content: 彼はお金をほしがっている "He wants money" 子供がおもちゃをほしがる "The child wants a toy"

children.heading: 〜がほしくてたまらない (want so badly)
children.content: 会いたくてたまらない "I want to see you so badly" お金がほしくてたまらない "I want money so badly"

children.heading: どうしても〜がほしい (want no matter what)
children.content: どうしてもこれがほしい "I want this no matter what" どうしても時間がほしい "I want time no matter what"

children.heading: 〜さえあればいい (just want)
children.content: お金さえあればいい "I just want money" 時間さえあればいい "I just want time"

sections.heading: With Quantities
sections.content: もっとお金がほしい "I want more money" 少し時間がほしい "I want a little time" たくさん友達がほしい "I want many friends"

sections.heading: Polite Requests with ほしい
sections.content:
When making requests, combine with other patterns:

手伝ってほしい (covered in next article) "I want you to help" For polite requests with objects: お水をいただけますか？ "Could I have some water?" Rather than: お水がほしいです (too direct)

children.heading: Material Items
children.content: お金がほしい - want money 車がほしい - want a car 家がほしい - want a house 服がほしい - want clothes 本がほしい - want books

children.heading: Abstract Concepts
children.content: 時間がほしい - want time 自由がほしい - want freedom 愛がほしい - want love 平和がほしい - want peace 勇気がほしい - want courage

children.heading: Relationships
children.content: 友達がほしい - want friends 恋人がほしい - want a boyfriend/girlfriend 家族がほしい - want family 仲間がほしい - want companions

children.heading: Don't Want
children.content: お金はほしくない "I don't want money" これはほしくないです "I don't want this" 何もほしくない "I don't want anything"

children.heading: Didn't Want
children.content: そんなものはほしくなかった "I didn't want such a thing" 何もほしくなかった "I didn't want anything"

children.heading: 〜がほしかったら (if you want)
children.content: お金がほしかったら、働きなさい "If you want money, work" 何かほしかったら、言ってね "If you want something, tell me"

children.heading: 〜がほしければ (if you want)
children.content: ほしければ、あげる "If you want it, I'll give it to you" 時間がほしければ、休んでもいい "If you want time, you can rest"

children.heading: Direct Expression
children.content:
ほしい is quite direct. In polite situations, soften with:

Direct: これがほしいです "I want this" Softer: これをいただけますか？ "Could I have this?" Or: これがほしいんですが "I want this (but...)"

children.heading: Gift Giving Culture
children.content: Japanese people often hesitate to directly say what they want, so asking 何がほしい？ directly is common among close friends and family but might be avoided in more formal situations.

children.heading: Basic Desires
children.content: お金がほしい "I want money" 新しい車がほしい "I want a new car" もっと時間がほしい "I want more time" 休みがほしい "I want a day off"

children.heading: Questions
children.content: 何がほしい？ "What do you want?" 誕生日に何がほしいですか？ "What do you want for your birthday?" 本当にほしい？ "Do you really want it?"

children.heading: Negative
children.content: お金はほしくない "I don't want money" これはほしくないです "I don't want this" 何もほしくない "I don't want anything"

children.heading: Past
children.content: 子供の頃、これがほしかった "When I was a child, I wanted this" あの時は時間がほしかった "At that time, I wanted time"

children.heading: With Intensity
children.content: すごくほしい "I really want it" どうしてもほしい "I want it no matter what" ほしくてたまらない "I want it so badly"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: 〜たい (tai) - Want to do 〜たがる (tagaru) - Want to (3rd person) 〜てほしい (te-hoshii) - Want someone to do I-adjective Conjugation - Similar pattern が Particle - Object marking ほしがる - Third person form
